headline: Unlocking the investment potential of private markets
summary: Private markets capturing the attention of asset management firm BlackRock. The Wall Street Journal’s Telis Demos telling Yahoo Finance’s Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton on Market Domination, the firm seems to be betting that private markets could morph into ETFs. “There's an enormous opportunity for a company like BlackRock to take the various pieces of the private credit market…package them up in away that suits various different investors' needs” says Demos. Demos further explaining a major frontier ahead for private markets in the ETF landscape. Although all these things have maybe existed for private assets available to the everyday investor, Demos says it's been more strategic than tactical. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Ivana Freitas

headline: Private credit’s struggling pioneer is a warning sign for market
summary: (Bloomberg) -- It was little more than two and a half years ago that Franklin Templeton’s boss Jenny Johnson took to LinkedIn to express her excitement about buying European private credit stalwart Alcentra. headline: Ethereum ETFs Record $1.3 Billion in Inflows as Ether Price Surpasses $4,000
